Flutter is an open-source UI software development toolkit created by Google.
Flutter uses the Dart programming language, which was also developed by Google.
Flutter allows for cross-platform development, meaning you can create apps for both Android and iOS with a single codebase.
Flutter was first announced in 2015 and released in its first stable version in December 2018.
Widgets are the core building blocks of a Flutter app's user interface.
Flutter's hot reload feature allows developers to see changes in real-time without restarting the app.
Flutter apps are compiled to native ARM code for both iOS and Android, which ensures high performance.
Google’s Fuchsia OS uses Flutter as its default framework for app development.
Flutter’s layout system is inspired by React, using a similar concept of widgets and components.
Flutter provides a rich set of pre-designed widgets for building complex UIs quickly.
The Flutter community is growing rapidly, with thousands of packages available on pub.dev to extend functionality.
Flutter supports state management solutions like Provider, Bloc, Riverpod, and many others.
Flutter web and desktop are in beta, allowing the creation of web and desktop applications from the same codebase.
Many popular apps, such as the Google Ads app and Alibaba's Xianyu, are built using Flutter.
Flutter’s rendering engine is called Skia, which is the same engine used by Google Chrome and Android.
